how-it-works.title: How does Jan de Belastingman work?

items.title: 1. Ask your question 24/7 and get instant answers
items.description: Do you have a question about your taxes? At Jan de Belastingman, ask your question online and get a clear answer right away from our smart AI chatbot. It is directly connected to the most up-to-date tax data, so whether it's about deductions, VAT or your tax return, you will always get a quick and reliable solution, without waiting! We handle your data securely and in compliance with AVG requirements.

items.title: 2. Need more help? We'll find you a suitable advisor
items.description: Sometimes a question is too specific for our chatbot, or you prefer to delegate (part of) your administration. No problem! Within 24 hours, Jan de Belastingman pairs you with an expert advisor who fully understands your situation and works out the rules for you personally. That way you always get specialist help that's just right for you, without the hassle.

items.title: 3. Create an account and manage your tax questions
items.description: With a free account with Jan de Belastingman, you'll keep everything organized. Sign up easily via social login (Google or Facebook) or your e-mail and save all your tax questions in one place. This way you can always look back at what you have asked - from allowances to deductions - and you don't have to keep starting over. Handy for now and later, for your next tax return, for example!

items.name: Martin de Vries
items.quote: Thanks to Jan de Belastingman, I found an excellent tax specialist who optimized my BV structure. This has saved me thousands of euros.

items.name: Sophie Jansen
items.quote: The advisor I was matched with perfectly understood my situation as a freelancer. Finally someone who has organized my administration!

items.name: Thomas Baker
items.quote: The matching process was quick and efficient. Within a day I was in contact with an advisor who knew exactly how to handle my international tax matter.

items.question: How does the matching process work?
items.answer: After completing the form, we review your question and situation. Based on this, we select an advisor from our network who best matches your needs. We'll contact you within 24 hours to connect you with this advisor.

items.question: Are there costs associated with the matching?
items.answer: No, the matching process is completely free and without obligation. You only pay for the services you may choose to take from the advisor we connect you with.

items.question: What kind of advisors are in your network?
items.answer: Our network consists of certified tax advisors, accountants, administration offices, and tax lawyers. All advisors are carefully selected based on their expertise, experience, and client satisfaction.

items.question: Can I also find an advisor for my personal tax return?
items.answer: Absolutely! We have advisors who specialize in both business and personal tax matters. Whether you need help with income tax, wealth tax, or other fiscal matters, we can connect you with the right expert.

story.title: Our Story
paragraphs: Jan de Belastingman was founded with a clear mission: to democratize tax advice and make expert guidance accessible to everyone in the Netherlands.

The idea came from firsthand experience working at a foundation that provided low-cost tax assistance. It became clear that a huge gap existed between tax expertise and the people who needed it, especially when tax situations became more complex. Many struggled with unclear rules, expensive advisors, and a lack of digital solutions.

With this in mind, a team of experts in AI, finance, and digital innovation set out to create a smarter, more accessible way to get tax help. The vision was set and the team built and scaled Jan de Belastingman to what it is today.

team.title: Our Team
team.description: At Jan de Belastingman, our team combines deep expertise in tax, technology, and business with the goal to make tax advice simple and accessible. With backgrounds in AI, finance, and innovation, we're dedicated to helping you navigate your tax matters with confidence.

members.name: Bo
members.background: A digital innovation leader, with a track record of guiding teams to executional excellence, creating people-focused solutions through smarter technology.

members.name: Tim
members.background: A growth strategist with 14+ years of experience in building brands and scaling digital startups through impactful marketing.

members.name: Beaudinn
members.background: A full-stack engineer with a decade of experience in AI and data-driven development, building secure, scalable, and high-performing systems.

members.name: Mathijs
members.background: A serial entrepreneur with a fiscal background, leveraging AI to build forward-thinking businesses that transform industries.

members.name: Marcus
members.background: An AI and SaaS innovator, driving multiple ventures that push technology forward and redefine digital solutions.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions and Latest Articles

faqItems.question: What is a BV and why should I establish one?
faqItems.answer: A BV (Private Limited Company) is a legal entity where the company is a separate legal person, distinct from its owners. Establishing a BV can offer advantages in terms of liability, taxes, and attracting investors. It's particularly suitable for entrepreneurs who want to separate their personal assets from company assets and who expect their business to grow.

faqItems.question: What tax benefits does a BV offer?
faqItems.answer: A BV can offer various tax benefits, including a lower corporate tax rate for profits up to €395,000 (15% in 2023), the ability to retain profits within the BV for reinvestment at a lower rate, and the option to pay yourself a salary and receive dividends. Additionally, there are tax optimization opportunities that aren't available for sole proprietorships or general partnerships.

faqItems.question: How can Jan de Belastingman help me manage my BV?
faqItems.answer: Jan de Belastingman provides expert advice and support in various areas of BV management, including tax planning, compliance with laws and regulations, financial reporting, and strategic advice. Our AI-powered chatbot can provide immediate answers to common questions, while our network of experienced advisors is available for more complex matters. We help you keep your BV financially healthy and make optimal use of available tax benefits.

support.title: Done-for-You Expat Tax Filing
support.description: Navigating Dutch taxes as an expat can be confusing, especially with foreign income, deductions, and complex forms like the M Form. Mistakes can lead to overpaying or missing out on benefits like the 30% ruling. Instead of spending hours figuring it all out, let our specialists handle everything for you—accurately, stress-free, and fully optimized for expat tax laws. Whether you've just moved, have dual-tax obligations, or want to maximize deductions, we ensure your tax return is filed correctly and on time.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions and Latest Articles

faqItems.question: What is the 30% ruling and am I eligible?
faqItems.answer: The 30% ruling is a tax advantage for highly skilled migrants working in the Netherlands. You may be eligible if you were recruited from abroad, earn above the minimum salary threshold, and have specific expertise scarce in the Dutch labor market. Our tax advisors can help determine your eligibility and guide you through the application process.

faqItems.question: Do I need to file taxes in the Netherlands as an expat?
faqItems.answer: Yes, if you live or work in the Netherlands, you generally need to file a tax return. This applies even if your income is from foreign sources. The specific form you need (P-form or M-form) depends on your residency status and when you arrived in or left the Netherlands during the tax year.

faqItems.question: How can Jan de Belastingman help with my expat taxes?
faqItems.answer: Jan de Belastingman provides comprehensive tax support for expats, including assistance with tax returns, M-forms, applying for the 30% ruling, and handling international tax situations. Our AI chatbot can answer immediate questions, while our network of experienced advisors is available for complex cases. We ensure you comply with Dutch tax regulations while maximizing available benefits and deductions.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions and Latest Articles

faqItems.question: When do I need to file an M form?
faqItems.answer: You need to file an M form if you immigrated to or emigrated from the Netherlands during the tax year. This special tax form is designed for people who were not residents of the Netherlands for the entire year.

faqItems.question: What information do I need for the M form?
faqItems.answer: You'll need details about your worldwide income (both Dutch and foreign), your migration date, tax residency information, and documentation about any assets or properties. For immigrants, you'll also need information about the 30% ruling if applicable.

faqItems.question: How can Jan de Belastingman help with my M form?
faqItems.answer: We provide comprehensive support for M form filing, from answering specific questions through our AI chatbot to connecting you with expert advisors for complex situations. We ensure all relevant deductions and benefits are claimed while maintaining compliance with Dutch tax regulations.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions and Latest Articles

faqItems.question: What tax credits am I entitled to?
faqItems.answer: As a taxpayer in the Netherlands, you may be entitled to various tax credits depending on your situation, including healthcare costs, business expenses, and home-related costs. Our system can help identify which credits apply to your specific case.

faqItems.question: How do I claim tax deductions?
faqItems.answer: Tax deductions can be claimed when filing your income tax return. Common deductible items include healthcare costs, donations, study costs, and certain business expenses. Jan de Belastingman can help you identify and properly claim all eligible deductions.

faqItems.question: Can I file a joint tax return with my partner?
faqItems.answer: Yes, if you and your tax partner both earn income in the Netherlands, you have the option to file a joint tax return. This can be advantageous depending on your specific situation and income levels.

metadata.title: Inheritance & Gift Tax in the Netherlands | Jan de Belastingman
metadata.description: Expert guidance on Dutch inheritance and gift tax. Get help understanding tax rates, exemptions, and filing requirements.
metadata.ogTitle: Dutch Inheritance & Gift Tax - Jan de Belastingman
metadata.ogDescription: Professional assistance with inheritance and gift tax matters in the Netherlands. Get reliable advice from our tax experts.
metadata.ogImageAlt: Inheritance Tax Guidance from Jan de Belastingman

hero.title: Expert assistance for Inheritance Tax (Erfbelasting) filing
hero.description: Have you received a gift from a Dutch resident and don't know how to proceed next and if any exceptions apply to you? Jan de Belastingman can help you figure it out and take the work off your hands.
hero.callToAction: Need Inheritance Tax Assistance? Chat With Us!

support.title: Inheritance tax In the Netherlands
support.description: Gift tax in the Netherlands applies to gifts from Dutch residents to others, regardless of the recipient's location. Similarly, inheritance tax is levied when a Dutch resident dies, affecting beneficiaries both in and outside the Netherlands. These taxes may also apply to individuals who have moved away from the Netherlands: Dutch citizens for up to 10 years after emigration for gifts or inheritance, and individuals of other nationalities for gifts made within one year of leaving.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions and Latest Articles

faqItems.question: What are the inheritance tax rates in the Netherlands?
faqItems.answer: The rates vary depending on your relationship to the deceased: Children and partners pay 10% up to €128,750 and 20% on the surplus. Grandchildren pay 18% up to €128,750 and 36% on the surplus. Any other person pays 30% up to €128,751 and 40% on the surplus.

faqItems.question: When does Dutch inheritance tax apply?
faqItems.answer: Dutch inheritance tax applies when a Dutch resident dies, regardless of where the beneficiaries live. It may also apply to Dutch citizens who have emigrated (for up to 10 years after leaving) and to certain assets located in the Netherlands.

faqItems.question: How does gift tax work in the Netherlands?
faqItems.answer: Gift tax applies to gifts from Dutch residents, regardless of the recipient's location. For Dutch citizens who have emigrated, it applies for up to 10 years after leaving. For non-Dutch nationals, it applies to gifts made within one year of leaving the Netherlands.

Within 24 hours, Jan de Belastingman will connect you with an expert advisor who fully understands your situation and will personally work out the rules for you. This way, you'll always get the help that fits your needs, hassle-free.

Easily sign up via social login (Google or Facebook) or email and save all your tax questions and answers in one location. This way, you can always review what you've asked - from allowances to deductions - and don't have to start over each time. Convenient for now and later, for example during your next tax return!

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions and Latest Articles

faqItems.question: What are the requirements for entrepreneurs/ZZP?
faqItems.answer: You must be registered with the KVK (Chamber of Commerce), maintain accurate financial records, and comply with Dutch tax regulations including VAT and income tax obligations to stay compliant as a self-employed professional.

faqItems.question: How can Jan de Belastingman help entrepreneurs/ZZP?
faqItems.answer: We provide comprehensive support for ZZP'ers, from answering specific questions about deductions and VAT returns through our AI chatbot to connecting you with expert advisors for complex situations. We help you optimize your taxes while maintaining compliance.

faqItems.question: What tax deductions are available for entrepreneurs/ZZP?
faqItems.answer: Self-employed professionals can claim various deductions including business expenses, home office costs, travel expenses, and professional development costs. Our system helps identify which deductions apply to your specific situation.

support.title: Healthcare allowance In the Netherlands

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions and Latest Articles

faqItems.question: What are the requirements for healthcare allowance?
faqItems.answer: You must be at least 18 years old, have Dutch health insurance, have an EU nationality or valid residence permit, and earn below €37,496 per year (2025). Additionally, your assets should be below €140,213.

faqItems.question: How is healthcare allowance calculated?
faqItems.answer: The amount depends on your income and assets. The lower your income, the higher the allowance. The system automatically calculates your entitlement based on the information you provide.

faqItems.question: When should I apply for healthcare allowance?
faqItems.answer: You can apply as soon as you meet the requirements. It's best to apply as early as possible since the allowance can be granted retroactively for up to 3 months from the application date.

support.title: Housing allowance In the Netherlands
support.description: The rent benefit (huurtoeslag) is a subsidy provided by the government to help with your rent expenses. Originally aimed at households with moderate incomes, it predominantly benefits those on the lower income spectrum.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions and Latest Articles

faqItems.question: What are the requirements for housing allowance?
faqItems.answer: You must have a signed rental agreement, be registered at the address, be at least 18 years old, have a valid residence permit, and live in a self-sufficient home. Your income and assets must also be below certain thresholds.

faqItems.question: How is housing allowance calculated?
faqItems.answer: The amount depends on your rent, income, household composition, and assets. The calculation takes into account the total household income and the number of people living at the address.

faqItems.question: Can I get housing allowance if I share a house?
faqItems.answer: Yes, but specific rules apply for shared housing. All residents must be registered at the address, and the total household income is considered in the calculation.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions and Latest Articles

faqItems.question: Who is eligible for childcare allowance?
faqItems.answer: You may be eligible if you and your partner work, study, or follow an integration course, have children under 12, use registered childcare, and pay the costs yourself. The exact amount depends on your income and the childcare hours needed.

faqItems.question: What types of childcare are covered?
faqItems.answer: The allowance covers registered daycare (kinderdagverblijf), out-of-school care (buitenschoolse opvang), and registered childminders (gastouderopvang). The childcare provider must be registered in the National Childcare Register (LRK).

faqItems.question: How is the allowance calculated?
faqItems.answer: The amount is based on your household income, the number of children in childcare, the type of childcare, and the hourly rate (up to a maximum). The lower your income, the higher the percentage of costs that will be reimbursed.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions and Latest Articles

faqItems.question: Who is eligible for child benefit?
faqItems.answer: You're eligible if you live or work in the Netherlands and have children under 18. The child must be your own, adopted, or stepchild, and you must be taking care of them. Special rules apply for children studying or living abroad.

faqItems.question: How much child benefit will I receive?
faqItems.answer: The amount depends on your child's age: 0-5 years, 6-11 years, or 12-17 years. Each age group receives a different quarterly payment. The exact amounts are adjusted twice a year based on price developments.

faqItems.question: When and how is child benefit paid?
faqItems.answer: Child benefit is paid quarterly by the SVB (Social Insurance Bank). The payment dates are in January, April, July, and October. The money is transferred directly to your bank account.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions and Latest Articles

faqItems.question: When do I receive AOW pension?
faqItems.answer: The AOW pension age is gradually increasing. In 2024, it's 67 years. You automatically receive a letter from the SVB a few months before you reach AOW age, with information about your pension payments.

faqItems.question: How is AOW pension calculated?
faqItems.answer: The amount depends on your living situation and how long you've lived in the Netherlands between ages 15 and AOW age. Each year contributes 2% to your full pension rights. Living or working abroad may affect your pension amount.

faqItems.question: What are the tax implications of AOW pension?
faqItems.answer: AOW pension is taxable income in the Netherlands. The tax rate depends on your total income, including any additional pensions or other income sources. We can help you understand your tax obligations and potential deductions.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions and Latest Articles

faqItems.question: How does additional income affect my AOW pension?
faqItems.answer: Your AOW pension amount itself isn't affected by additional income, but your total income may affect your tax bracket and potential benefits or allowances you receive. We can help you understand the implications and optimize your tax situation.

faqItems.question: What are the tax implications of working during AOW?
faqItems.answer: When you work while receiving AOW, both your pension and work income are taxed. However, you may be eligible for specific tax credits and deductions. The total tax rate depends on your combined income from all sources.

faqItems.question: Are there limits to how much I can earn alongside AOW?
faqItems.answer: There's no limit to how much you can earn while receiving AOW pension. However, higher income may affect other benefits or allowances you receive, such as healthcare allowance or rent subsidy.
